title: Popular Palmerston North confectionery store up for grabs
text:
Popular Palmerston North confectionery store up for grabs PAUL MITCHELL Last updated 16:09, February 7 2017 David Unwin/Fairfax NZ 
Munchkins owner Oleene Wells promises to pass on the recipes for her fudge. 
The sale of a popular confectionery company could be a golden ticket for an inventive entrepreneur as a Palmerston North Willy Wonka looks for a successor. 
Oleene Wells started Munchkins "on a whim" nearly 30 years ago and grew it into a Palmerston North icon, known for its unique and creative fudge flavours. 
For decades, Munchkins has been a first stop for many of the city's residents looking for a gift for sweet-toothed loved ones. 
From Jelly Tip to fish'n chip, Wells has delighted in discovering ways to recreate food favourites in fudge and making even the oddest inspirations work. 
READ MORE: * Broadway braces for Farmers Plaza move 
Wells said she found a life-long passion when she bought a Plaza confectionery store 26 years ago. 
"It really was an impulse purchase. I just went to the bank, the bank manager said 'yeah, I know your parents, it'll be sweet.' 
"I don't think it works like that anymore." 
The years hadn't dulled her passion for confectionery, but she felt it was time for a change. 
"I get people saying 'you must be sick of it by now', but I'm quite dedicated to sweet things. Ad Feedback 
"I see people who've lost the passion for their business, and I don't want to get to that." 
Wells hoped to sell to a successor who loved sweets and would continue to add new and unexpected flavours to Munchkins' range. 
The imaginative flavours and keeping the taste and texture consistent from batch to batch is a point of pride for Wells, and she'll pass her recipes to the new owner. 
"I'll help them along and teach them [how to make the fudge]. I'll part with all my secrets." 
She'll pass on the tricks behind the bestselling flavours like creme brulee and salted caramel and Kiwiana favourites like pineapple lumps and jelly tip. 
They'll even get the recipe for her latest creation a fish'n chip flavoured fudge, which has been puzzling people since it came out late last year. 
"A lot of people are coming in and asking how are you doing that?" Wells said. 
But she wasn't parting with that particular secret just yet. - Stuff
